content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe on Allrecipes that includes ingredients like olives, has at least a 4-star rating, and more than 25 reviews. Detail the ingredients, cooking method, and total time required for preparation and cooking.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe with olives and specified rating/review requirements, I need to use the search function. The search textbox is visible at [2] and the search button at [3].
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish with olives
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish with olives

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for "Mediterranean grilled fish with olives" yielded no results. To broaden the search and increase the chance of finding relevant recipes, I should try a simpler query (e.g., "Mediterranean grilled fish") and then manually check for olives in the ingredients list on the results page.
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for "Mediterranean grilled fish" also returned no results. The search may be too specific or there might be an issue with how the search is being executed. I should try an even broader query such as "grilled fish" and look for Mediterranean-style recipes with olives in the results.
Action: Type [2]; grilled fish
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Even the broad query "grilled fish" returns 0 results, which is unusual for Allrecipes. This suggests a potential technical issue with the search feature or a temporary site problem. The best action is to refresh the search process by clearing the previous search term and trying a generic approach.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: A new search box is now visible at [8] with a "GO" button at [9], suggesting an alternative search interface. I should try a very broad term like "fish" to maximize the chance of getting results, then narrow down the options for Mediterranean-style with olives.
Action: Type [8]; fish
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Even the search for the very broad term "fish" is returning 0 results, which strongly suggests that there is a technical issue or bug with the Allrecipes search function at this moment, rather than the query itself being too narrow. It is unlikely that Allrecipes has no results for "fish". Trying to clear the search term again and using the main homepage search may help, or reloading could reset the search feature.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.32
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is still showing "0 results found for your search." The input box [8] and "GO" button [9] are visible, suggesting I have another opportunity to search. Since previous broad queries did not work, I will attempt a very basic term, "chicken," to check if any search works at all, indicating if the issue is with the search function in general.
Action: Type [8]; chicken
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.34
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Even the search for "chicken" yields 0 results, which confirms a significant technical problem with the search feature—Allrecipes should return many results for such a common query. Further attempts using different keywords are unlikely to succeed until this underlying issue is resolved. It would be best to try a different approach or wait until the website is functioning properly.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "0 results found for your search." message is still present, confirming that searches for any keyword—including extremely common ones like "fish" and "chicken"—are yielding no results on Allrecipes. This strongly suggests a persistent technical issue with the website’s search functionality. Clicking around or trying more search terms is unlikely to succeed given this state.
Action: Click [1] (to try returning to the homepage as a last resort in case it resets the search system or offers alternative browsing methods).
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.36
token: : Click [1] (to try returning to the homepage as a last resort in case it resets the search system or offers alternative browsing methods).

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am now back on the Allrecipes homepage. The primary search box is visible at [2] with its search button at [3]. Since previous searches failed due to possible technical issues with the category/filtered search, trying the main homepage search box for "fish" or "Mediterranean fish" might work. This is the default homepage functionality, likely to be most reliable.
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean fish
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for "Mediterranean fish" has also resulted in "0 results found for your search," confirming that the search feature is not working properly. Both broad and specific queries are not returning any recipes, which is highly abnormal for Allrecipes and indicates an ongoing technical problem.
Action: Click [1] (to return to the homepage again, as a last resort to reset potential broken states, possibly try browsing categories if available from the homepage or main menu).
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.4
token: : Click [1] (to return to the homepage again, as a last resort to reset potential broken states, possibly try browsing categories if available from the homepage or main menu).

The "Main menu for Allrecipes" button [0] may open navigation options, potentially letting me browse fish/seafood recipes or categories manually, bypassing the broken search.
